title: Antony Blinken to embark on high-stakes trip to China
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is expected to travel to China in the coming weeks for talks, two U.S. officials told NBC News.

title: Prince Harry testifies against British tabloid’s ‘unlawful information gathering’
description: Prince Harry took the stand in a London courtroom, testifying in his lawsuit against Mirror Group Newspapers, who the duke claims used "unlawful information gathering" against him for decades. NBC News’ Meagan Fitzgerald breaks down the main takeaways from Prince Harry’s testimony and how attorneys for the Mirror Group Newspapers are responding to his allegations.

title: Destroyed dam in Ukraine triggers possible environmental crisis
description: A critical dam and hydro-electric power plant in the Russian-controlled region of Kherson in southern Ukraine was destroyed in an overnight explosion, putting tens of thousands of people at risk of flooding. NBC News’ Molly Hunter breaks down what both sides are saying about the explosion and how the catastrophe could have major environmental impacts.

title: Brazilian Astrud Gilberto, who sang 'The Girl from Ipanema' is dead at 83
description: Astrud Gilberto, the Brazilian singer and songwriter famous for “The Girl from Ipanema,” has died at age 83.

title: French protesters march against Macron’s pension reforms
description: Nationwide protests are underway across France as hundreds of thousands march against President Emmanuel Macron’s pension reforms, which he controversially fast-tracked through parliament. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports from Paris.

title: World War II vets return to Normandy for 79th anniversary of D-Day
description: Ceremonies are underway to commemorate the 79th anniversary of the World War II battle of D-Day on the beaches Normandy, France, that was pivotal to the defeat of Hitler. NBC’s Kelly Cobiella reports for TODAY.

title: Video reportedly shows flooding in the town of Nova Kakhovka after dam wall breach
description: Video captured by Russian television reportedly showed flooding in the streets of Nova Kakhovka after explosions in a nearby dam for which both Russia and Ukraine blamed each other.

title: Dam in Ukraine destroyed, unleashing massive surge of water
description: Ukraine is accusing Russia of blowing up the critical Nova Kakhovka dam in the Kherson region Tuesday, leading to mass evacuations and putting a nearby nuclear plant in jeopardy. NBC’s Molly Hunter reports for TODAY.

title: Water levels in Dnipro River tributary rise over three feet after Kakhovka dam breach, residents say
description: A pier on a tributary river to the Dnipro was flooded in Kherson after the Kakhovka dam was breached following explosions that both Russia and Ukraine blamed on each other.

title: Cellphone video shows damaged generator building at the Kakhovka dam
description: Cellphone video verified by NBC News shows damage at a generator building on Ukraine's Kakhovka dam and water gushing through a nearby hole.

title: Surveillance video from November 2022 shows explosions at the Kakhovka dam
description: There were explosions at Ukraine's Kakhovka dam in early November 2022. British military intelligence at the time said it was almost certainly the work of Russian forces using controlled detonations.

title: Drone video shows water surging through a huge hole in Ukraine's Kakhovka dam
description: Drone video captured water surging through the critical Kakhovka dam in Russian-held Ukraine, immediately sparking evacuations from nearby areas and an emergency meeting in Kyiv.
